item.title: Met officers working for Andrew told to guard Epstein's home, emails show
item.description:
Met officers working for Andrew told to guard Epstein's home, emails show 4 hours ago Share Save Olivia Davies , Chi Chi Izundu and Helena Wilkinson , BBC News Investigations Share Save PA Media Metropolitan Police officers were instructed to provide security for a dinner party at Jeffrey Epstein's New York home attended by Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, according to emails released by the US Department of Justice. The Met says it has not identified any wrongdoing by its protection...

item.title: 'Effective' SEND support won't be taken away, minister says
item.description:
'Effective' SEND support won't be taken away, minister says 4 hours ago Share Save Joshua Nevett Political reporter Share Save Education Secretary Bridget Phillipson: "We are not going to be taking away effective support for children" The government will not be withdrawing "effective support" from children with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) under its planned school reforms for England, the education secretary has said. Bridget Phillipson told the BBC the...

item.title: Trump curious why Iran has not 'capitulated', US envoy Witkoff says
item.description:
Trump curious why Iran has not 'capitulated', US envoy Witkoff says 34 minutes ago Share Save Jaroslav Lukiv and Ghoncheh Habibiazad , BBC Persian Share Save Reuters The US has been building up its military presence near Iran in recent weeks US President Donald Trump is questioning why Iran has not yet "capitulated" in the face of Washington's military build-up in the Middle East, the US president's special envoy Steve Witkoff has said. Witkoff told Fox News on Saturday that....

item.title: William in tribute to Tik Tok medic found dead at barracks
item.description:
William in tribute to medic found dead at barracks 1 hour ago Share Save Matty Edwards and Maisie Lillywhite , West of England Share Save Welsh Guards Prince William met Corporal Lucy Wilde in March 2024, when she was serving with the Welsh Guards The Prince of Wales has spoken of his "immense sadness" over the death of a young Army medic who had become a Tiktok star. Corporal Lucy Wilde, who shared videos documenting her daily life, was found dead in her barracks in Warminster, Wiltshire, on 5....

item.title: USA win men's Olympic ice hockey gold for first time in 46 years
item.description:
To play this video you need to enable JavaScript in your browser. This video can not be played Media caption, 'Jack Hughes is the golden boy' - USA beat Canada in overtime By Emma Smith BBC Sport journalist at Milano Santagiulia Ice Hockey Arena Published 46 minutes ago 155 The United States won the men's Olympic ice hockey gold medal for the first time in 46 years by beating neighbours Canada 2-1 in a sensational conclusion to the 2026 Winter Olympics. item.title: In Pictures: The best of the Winter Olympics - day by day
item.description:
Published 9 February 2026 Updated 24 minutes ago BBC Sport and Getty Images bring you a selection of the most striking images from each day of the Winter Olympics. Day 15: Saturday, 21 February Image caption, United States' pilot Kaillie Armbruster Humphries and Jasmine Jones compete in the bobsleigh two-woman heat three at Cortina Sliding Centre. Photo by Al Bello Image caption, Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo celebrates winning a record sixth gold medal with victory in the...

item.title: Penis injections, swearing curlers and a wolfdog - Olympic stories you might have missed
item.description:
Image source, EPA Image caption, A dog joined in at the Olympic women's cross-country skiing By Katie Falkingham BBC Sport senior journalist in Livigno Published 9 hours ago The Olympics. There's nothing quite like it. The world's greatest sporting showcase - and a hub of weird and wonderful stories. Think the Australian breakdancer, the 'Muffin Man' and the random guy in his swimming trunks at Paris 2024. The robots at Beijing 2022. The green diving pool at Rio 2016....

item.title: How sister's success paved way for Atkin's bronze
item.description:
To play this video you need to enable JavaScript in your browser. This video can not be played Media caption, 'I've dreamed about this' - Atkin on her halfpipe bronze By Katie Falkingham BBC Sport senior journalist in Livigno Published 22 February 2026, 11:07 GMT Updated 4 hours ago In 2018, as a 15-year-old, Zoe Atkin watched her big sister Izzy win Winter Olympic bronze for Team GB - and a spark was lit. She wanted her moment on the podium. She wanted to do the same. That fire.....

item.title: All you need to know ahead of the Bafta Film Awards 2026
item.description:
All you need to know ahead of the Bafta Film Awards 2026 17 hours ago Share Save Emma Saunders Culture reporter Share Save Getty Images Chase Infiniti, Leonardo DiCaprio and Teyana Taylor are all nominated for One Battle After Another Hollywood stars are set to descend on London for the 2026 Bafta Film Awards on Sunday, the biggest night in the British film calendar. An A-list showdown is expected between Paul Thomas Anderson's darkly comic political thriller One Battle After Another,...
